intro: Zanthoxylum beecheyanum, commonly known as the Beachey's prickly ash, is a shrub or small tree native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are usually opposite and have serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. Zanthoxylum beecheyanum is part of the Rutaceae family, which includes other citrus and related plants. It is often used in traditional medicine and has a distinctive, spicy aroma.
